title: [K-12] Intentional Practice and Real-Time Feedback Integrated Pedagogy for High-Quality CPR Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Understanding of Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) Procedures
context.additional_context: Emergency response skill development linked to language curricula, targeting pre-service and in-service teachers

learning_goals: Learners must perform high-quality CPR at an accurate compression rate of 100-120 per minute for 1 minute
Learners must perform chest compressions while maintaining accurate compression depth of 5-6 cm
Learners must self-diagnose and correct compression depth and rate using a real-time feedback system

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
